item.title: Considerations on AI
item.description: In 2015 while studying Soft Computing as an undergrad I was introduced to Neural Networks and the gradients back-propagating through them. I have been working in and around Machine Learning since then. Back then the data and infrastructure limitations often kept the small and exciting companies away from the newest Deep Learning based models. Most of the interesting applications in the new startups were in tabular data with classical Machine Learning techniques (regression and classification using linear and tree-based models).
